utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Episode 8x18

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY SHIPTON
utterance.content: Remind me, why am I doing this?

utterance.speaker: BRYCE ROBERTS
utterance.content: Because I saved your ass in Marrakech.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I let you save my ass, old man, so that you could impress Miss Naughty-Knickers whom you had a crush on.

utterance.speaker: MARCUS JANEK
utterance.content: You know, for a couple of ex-spies, you sound a lot like sorority girls at spring break.

utterance.speaker: BRYCE
utterance.content: Hayley, this is Marcus. He’s going in with you.

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: Bryce told me you were a badass, but he didn’t say you were an X-rated fantasy.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: It’s very hard to focus on how charming you are when your breath smells like a festival toilet.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Please tell me he’s a better sneak than he is a pickup artist.

utterance.speaker: BRYCE
utterance.content: A simple job. Twenty minutes tops. My client is married to the VP of Manchester Energy International, Paul Halston. She’s convinced he’s cheating. So, Marcus will bypass building security while Hayley puts spyware on his office computer.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: All right, let’s do this.

utterance.speaker: BRYCE
utterance.content: Thanks again. I owe you.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yes, you do.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: What kind of spyware is this? It’s taking forever to upload.

utterance.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MAN
utterance.content: Shh! This is my office.

utterance.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED WOMAN
utterance.content: It’s so fancy! Oh, my goodness.

utterance.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MAN
utterance.content: Look at that. That’s where I sit.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Talk about a breach of security.

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: I’d like to breach hers, that’s for sure.

utterance.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED WOMAN
utterance.content: You can not.

utterance.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MAN
utterance.content: Yes, I can.

utterance.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED WOMAN
utterance.content: Oh, wow. That’s so cool. I guess it’s only fair, right?

utterance.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MAN
utterance.content: You gonna show me?

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: She’s way out of his league.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: And yours, by the way.

utterance.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED WOMAN
utterance.content: Is this nice? Whoop!

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: Ten bucks he can’t even figure out how to get that thing off.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Pass.

utterance.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED WOMAN
utterance.content: Oh. Ooh, it’s okay.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Here. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: Hold on. They’re just getting to the good part.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I’m leaving.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re up early. Sleep OK?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no, no, no. No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Did I snore?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but that’s not the problem.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You betrayed me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? How? When?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Last night, in my dreams.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But that’s — I — What’s, uh — How — What could I have possibly done that was so wrong?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what, never mind. I don’t even want to relive it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, technically, you didn’t live it. You just dreamed it. That’s — But I —

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s the precinct.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why do I feel like a murder just saved my life?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Okay, ladies, I have decided that I should change my autograph, so… what do you think?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Gram, that looks exactly like your usual autograph.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no. My usual autograph, when I am merely an actress, is like this, sort of carefree and — and whimsical, whereas the other conveys insight, wisdom. They’re completely different. Can’t you see that?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Insight.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Wisdom.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Absolutely. Good job.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Now, if you’ll excuse me, I have a business to run, especially since you-know-who is completely useless.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I heard that. And if I’m so useless, why would Beckett ask me to consult on a murder? Oh, Mother, new autograph.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice. Conveys wisdom, insight. I like it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. I just need my car keys and I’m off to the Manchester Energy Building.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Wait, murder at Manchester Energy? Who’s the victim?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All they said was “dead male”.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Ah. You know, Rick, I’ve never really seen you in action at an NYPD crime scene.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, perhaps you’d like to tag along, watch the crime scene Jedi master at work.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Please tell me you do not refer to yourself as that. Do you really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perhaps you should come watch another time.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No, no. Lead on, Castle Wan Kenobi. You are my only hope.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I like that, but save it. Say it in front of the guys.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hayley. What happened? Did you lose a bet and now Castle gets to drag you everywhere he goes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Quite the contrary. Hayley actually wanted to watch me solve yet another murder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You mean…help solve. You…help.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, remember, bro, you cannot solve a homicide without us.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But we sure as hell can solve one without you.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Really? Because on the ride over here, Rick was bragging about how the NYPD can’t close a case unless —

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eh, those were just jokes that — out of context, it’s not as funny. I was rolling my eyes when I said it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you for stabbing me in the back.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: You weren’t the only one. Our victim took his right between his T4 and T5 vertebrae. Severed his spinal cord. Died instantly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m guessing from his outfit, he wasn’t an employee?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Most likely some kind of thief.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Pretty good one at that. None of the security was tripped. All the cameras were shut down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was anything stolen?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What’s there to steal? I mean, this is an energy-company office building. The only thing of value are the furniture and the computers.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: May I?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Clearly, we’re helpless. So please, Castle, solve this case for us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, the only thing we know for sure is —

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: He was killed at 3:27 a.m.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Very good, Hayley.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who, wait. What? How did you know that?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Broken watch. He must have busted it when he hit the ground.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Esposito, we have Hayley. What do we need Castle for?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Super funny, guys. That was lucky, and I can still help I.D. this victim, thank you very much. Lanie, run a fingerprint scan.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: OK, Look, Castle, I don’t know what all of this is about, but I don’t tell you how to write your books, so don’t tell me how to I.D. a body. I’ve already performed a scan, just waiting for the results.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Do you think it’s possible to identify the victim from the purchase of these mints?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I guess we could. It’s far more efficient to use a fingerprint scanner.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh! Oh, I just bolloxed up a piece of evidence. I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rookie move, right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because you’ve never touched anything at a crime scene.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Make note that this is contaminated with Hayley’s prints.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: So sorry.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, here we go. We got an ID on our victim. His name is Marcus Janek. He’s, uh,

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks like somebody caught Marcus in the act and killed him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or perhaps Marcus had a partner.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Partner?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Marcus is a burglar. He is on high alert. The only reason he’d let someone behind him is if he trusted that person, i.e. a partner. We find the person Marcus broke in here with, we find his killer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Very good, Castle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, that makes a lot of sense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why are you acting surprised?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I don’t know if it’s important at all, but all those chairs are tucked in except for that one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except for that one there. Yep, I noticed that, too. On the way in, way before she did. So…Ned Werner. Perhaps Ned was working late last night. Maybe he saw something, or maybe he’s Marcus’ partner, an inside man.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Detective Ryan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thank you, Detective Esposito.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: After you boys.

utterance.speaker: BRYCE
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Bryce, Marcus is dead. What the hell is going on? Does this have anything to do with your client?

utterance.speaker: BRYCE
utterance.content: Hayley, I’m sorry. I lied about everything. There is no cheating husband, nor an angry wife.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: What? How could you be so —

utterance.speaker: BRYCE
utterance.content: I had no choice.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Why? Who put you up to this?

utterance.speaker: BRYCE
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter. Not any more. All you need to know is Code 44. I’m sorry, Hayley. I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Hayley, the guys are thinking that… Everything okay?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Uh, no. A friend of mine’s fallen ill, and, um, I’ve got to swing by, check in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Dammit, Alexis, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I needed some case files for work, but if this is how you get when people come over unannounced, I am happy to give you back your spare key.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So, uh, redecorating?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You need to leave. Now.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I see what’s going on. You’ve got your go-bag, your guns. Is this why you wanted to go by that crime scene? Hayley, if you’re in trouble, talk to me.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I can’t. It’s not safe. Okay, look, I did a favor for a friend last night — at least I thought he was a friend. It was meant to be a quick P.I. job, but technically, I broke a few laws.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay, well, tell Beckett, tell my dad. They can help.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No, they can’t. The friend I was working with — we were in MI6 together. He just phoned. It turns out the job wasn’t legit. Something bigger is going on, something bad enough that he told me to go Code 44.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What does Code 44 mean?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: It means abandon everything and everyone. It means run for your life and don’t look back.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You can’t do that.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I have no choice.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yes, you do. After years of floating from one place to the next, you’ve finally found a real home here.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: And I might be putting you and it in danger by staying. I have to go now.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, you have to stay and fight, figure out what’s really going on here and fix it. Please at least try.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello, gentlemen.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ooh. Castle, you shouldn’t show your face around here right now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Beckett’s pissed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, guys, it was a dream.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, dreams are doorways to the subconscious, Castle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And what you did was just so…wrong.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She told you what I did? What did I do?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, we’re sworn to secrecy, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, unlike some, we would never do that to Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was a dream.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dream or not, you did something in real life, and Beckett’s subconscious is picking up on it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You need to figure out what that was and come clean before it’s too late.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I —

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Here’s Ned. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, how’s your friend doing?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hmm? Oh, uh, much better, thanks. You know, my curiosity’s been piqued. Can we watch his interview?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, sure, just wait till… Okay, go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So Mr. Werner, tell us where you were between 3:00 and 4:00 a.m. this morning.

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: Home. Alone, asleep.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, that’s weird, Ned, because your office computer says that you logged in at 3:02 a.m., just minutes before the murder.

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: Oh, wait, no, yes. Yes. I was, uh — Now that you mention it, yes, I did. I popped into the office for a bit, just to do some work. I did not see him there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you were in the office alone?

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: Yeah, completely alone.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You lying little bastard.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What makes you think he’s lying about being alone?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Look at his neck. See that tiny love bite? It’s new. So if Ned was alone last night, who gave him that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you lying to us, Ned?

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: No. No, I would not lie. No, never. No. No.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You lied about not being there.

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: I didn’t. I didn’t lie. I just forgot.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, you forgot?

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So maybe there’s something else you forgot.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe you forgot that Marcus was your partner and you let him in.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And you forgot that you killed him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you remember killing him.

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s perfect.

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no! Yes, yes, yes, I didn’t forget, because no, I didn’t kill him. Look, I don’t know this man. I’ve never seen him before in my life, so I couldn’t have killed him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So your office computer says you logged out at 3:10 a.m. He was killed at 3:27 a.m. Actually, you could have killed him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: Wait. 3:27?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: No, no, no. I could not have killed him, because I was in a Hytch ride by then. See? Driver picked me up at 3:19 a.m.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hello, Neddie. Let’s have a chat, shall we?

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: Are you a cop? The other detective said I was free to go!

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Not quite.

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: Okay, okay, okay!

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: Yes, yes, I will. Yes!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell is going on in here?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Well, this gentleman would like to revise his statement.

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: Yes. I would like to revise my statement. I was not alone in my office. Uh, about 2:00 a.m., in a bar, I met a smoking-hot blonde chick…

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: Who — she’s a very lovely young lady named Karla, and we hit it off, so I took her back to my office.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So why did you lie to my detectives?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Because a security breach like this could get Nasty Ned here fired. Go on. Tell the nice captain what you did.

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: I was trying to impress Karla, so I…

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: I logged in to the company’s closed server, and I shut down the power at 10 Downing Street for a second.

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: It didn’t work, though. We didn’t have sex or nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. Shocking.

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: No. She was very frisky with me. And then all of a sudden, she said she was bored. Wanted to go home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: I think maybe it was because I was having trouble undoing her corset. In my defense, it was, like, crazy complicated, and — and — and I was — I was — I was very nervous.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: So after you logged on to your computer is when Karla left you?

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: Yes. And as far as I know, the office was completely empty when I left.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you actually see Karla leave the building?

utterance.speaker: NED
utterance.content: N-No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So it’s possible she hid and then waited until you left?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Ryan, Ned here wants to revise his statement.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Awesome. Had a little accident? Don’t touch anything, please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me, Hayley. Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, guys. Is there a problem here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hayley waterboarded Ned.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I did no such thing. It was more of a swirly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Never mind. Look, apparently, Ned was tricked by some woman named Karla into gaining access to the building and the secured server, most likely to help Marcus rob the place.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yeah, but clearly something happened between Marcus and Karla, because it looks like she’s the one that drove that knife into his back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And is that all?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Why are you asking me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because clearly something is going on with you, Hayley — something connected to this case. You know, you can tell us.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I was in that office last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, we need to talk. Now.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Really? You want to talk in here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. This is where we question all of our murder suspects.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You think I killed Marcus.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right now, I don’t know what to think.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: An old friend of mine from MI6, Bryce Roberts, hired me and Marcus to do some P.I. work, to install some spy software on the VP of Manchester Energy’s computer. At least, that’s what I thought we were doing. Right in the middle of it all, in walked Ned and Karla, so I finished my part of the job, and I took off. Marcus stayed to watch Ned and Karla go at it. Must have been part of their plan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Marcus and Karla were partners?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Must have been. Although what they were really after and why she killed him, I have no bloody idea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Tell me about Bryce.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: He was my team leader back when I freelanced for MI6.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were you guys close?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yeah, for a while. Then everything went to hell on an op, and I cut all ties with MI6. A few months ago, he retired from Her Majesty’s service, started a freelance security company here in New York. He got back in touch. He’s a good man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So why did he involve you?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yeah, I’d like to ask him that myself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea where we can find him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you sure Bryce’s ex-wife still lives here?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I hope so. He would have come to say goodbye before he went Code 44.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s no cars here. It doesn’t look like anybody’s —

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Police!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How bad?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We got a body here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Bryce! Bryce.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Stabbed in the back, just like Marcus.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Right between the T4 and T5 vertebrae. I don’t believe it’s coincidence. I’m sorry about your friend.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, you can’t blame yourself for this. Bryce lied. He chose to trick you.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Bryce was leveraged, compromised.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but by whom. Hey, what are they getting you mixed up in?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. So unis are canvassing the neighborhood, but there’s no trace of our suspect.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: It had to be Karla.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Could be she’s cleaning up loose ends. I mean, her partners are dead. All Karla has to do now is disappear.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would she break into Manchester Energy building in the first place? What were they after? And why do they need Hayley to be a part of it?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Wait. Hang on. $10 million was just wired into my bank account. From Manchester Energy. What the hell is going on?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re the patsy.

utterance.speaker: TV REPORTER
utterance.content: We are getting confirmation that the massive blackout that has hit London is due to a cyber attack on Manchester Energy International, an electric and gas company with offices in Europe and in the United States.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The money in your account is the noose that hangs the cyber attack around your neck.

utterance.speaker: TV REPORTER
utterance.content: It may take weeks before they’re able to restore full power to the city’s grid.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I just assumed that Bryce was telling the truth. How could I have been so stupid?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was a thumb drive Bryce gave you, wasn’t it?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, God, it must have had a virus of some sort.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, I spoke with the FBI, and they are considering this an act of terror.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: How bad’s the damage?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s gonna be a few days before the power’s back up in London, maybe more.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Fantastic. So I may have unwittingly plunged my hometown back into the 16th century.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That might not be all that bad — I mean, Hamlet was written in the 16th century. I’m not helping.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Kate, do they know about my involvement yet?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They traced the money to your account, and there is a warrant out for your arrest.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Scuse me. Hayley, uh, is this Karla?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh yes, with our old friend Ned.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The security camera across the street caught them leaving this bar on their way to the office. The bartender remembers Karla, but he’d never seen her before that night, and unfortunately, Ned paid the bill.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: So we have no way to track her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we’re scrubbing Bryce and Marcus’ computers and cell phones. One of them had to have been in contact with her. Don’t worry. We’ll find her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, we’ll keep you in the loop, but a police precinct is probably the worst place to hide from the feds.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We can go back to the P.I. office. You can stay out of sight in the panic room until we clear your name.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No. I can’t let you guys cover for me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. We got your back. Just go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How bad is it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s gonna need a miracle to stay out of jail.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I wish I remembered something about her — a tattoo, a scar. You want a laugh? The only thing I recall about this woman is poor Ned fumbling around with her fancy corset.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell me more. Was it cotton or lace?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Ew.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Perv much?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m serious.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Okay, it was lace with black leather. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Narrows it down. Padded?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Back or front clasps?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Back clasps and buckles, and it had a metal ring in the front with snaps.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Were there crystal studs across the décolletage?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Actually, yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: La Seductrice. Give me a moment to pull up the 2016 Mon Cheri collection.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: That’s it. That’s the one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And voilà. My work here is done.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, Dad, uh, should I even ask?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Nikki Heat” research.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, there’s only one La Seductrice in New York. I will e-mail this to Espo and Ryan, and see if they can track her down by her unmentionables.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, damn it. I recognize him. He’s MI6.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I guess the FBI aren’t the only ones investigating. You guys get in the panic room.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: Hello, Mr. Castle. The name’s Stephen Mallory.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you mean Agent Mallory, MI6?

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: Well, I wonder how you knew that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lucky guess. Do come in.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: Lovely decor. Retro, but chic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you. But I assume Her Majesty’s Secret Service isn’t interested in my interior designer.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: No. However, your business partner interests us greatly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, well, I haven’t seen Hayley since this morning.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, I must find Ms. Shipton before it’s too late, before I can no longer help her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, Hayley left MI6 for a reason. I doubt she needs your kind of help, Agent Mallory.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: You may think you know Ms. Shipton, but in fact, you do not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could have fooled me.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: I’m sure she has. Tell me, did Ms. Shipton ever tell you why she left MI6?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something about holiday bonuses and bad fish and chips.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: Charming.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, despite what you think, I can assure you Hayley was framed.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: And i can assure you she is the main conspirator in everything that happened today.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can you be so sure about that?

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: I have access to her confidential dossiers, Mr. Castle. You must trust me — Ms. Shipton is intimately involved in the planning and the execution of today’s events. We have proof.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Ignore him. Everything he’s saying is classic counterintelligence.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: Ms. Shipton was, arguably, one of the most ruthless, cold-hearted operatives in the history of MI6. Truth be told, on her final mission, to save her own skin, she let her own partner die.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: I think that would be an indication of exactly the type of person you’re dealing with.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: She might very well do the same to you…

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: …or to your daughter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, as I said, Agent Mallory, as far as where Hayley is, I haven’t got a clue.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: Well, if you ever get one, it would be in your best interest to call.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was all that about MI6 having proof you’re behind this?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: It’s all lies.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Even what he said about your old partner? That was a lie, too?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You let your partner die.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No. Wesley died because — because…It’s complicated. Look, don’t let Mallory get into your head. You know you can trust me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Your tip about the corset paid off.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You found Karla?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We reached out to that lingerie shop and I.D.’d our blonde.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Her real name is Beth Wynne. She’s a longtime grifter who’s worked a lot of scams.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Interesting.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And get this — One of her aliases just checked into a motel at 153rd by JFK. We’re headed there right now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ll let you know if we find her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where are you going? I thought you were staying out of sight.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: She killed my friend. I’m going to be there for the arrest.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not alone you’re not.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hayley, you’re not supposed to be here.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: And yet here I am.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle, you didn’t stop her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like I could stop her even if I wanted to.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey, guys. That’s her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beth Wynne, NYPD - Hey! Come here!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beth Wynne, you’re under arrest for the murders of Marcus Janek and Bryce Roberts.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: No, no, no. You are not hanging this one me. I didn’t kill anyone. When I left Manchester Energy, Marcus was alive. I came straight back here. You can check the motel surveillance cameras.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: What about Bryce?

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: I didn’t kill him. I was here. I haven’t even left this place till now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, then what really happened last night? What were you doing there when Hayley and Marcus were breaking in?

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: I was the bait for that idiot Ned. The computer system required two separate security keys. You can’t just hack in and upload a worm. It had to be embedded while a secure portal was open.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you made sure that Ned logged in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And after that, the worm that Hayley unintentionally planted was allowed to wreak havoc on London’s power grid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Marcus was a run-of-the-mill cat burglar at best. How would he come up with such an elaborate plan?

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: He was just following orders.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: From who?

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: A man named Edgar Patton.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You never met this man?

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: No. Marcus was the point man, and he brought me onto this job.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Marcus say anything about him? Come on, you gotta know something.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: He’s a smoker, I guess. The night before the job, Marcus met Edgar at some fancy club to get the worm program. When Marcus came back, both him and his laptop stunk like cigars, and that’s all I know.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Where’s Marcus’ laptop now?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Okay, if there’s still a copy of the worm program on here, I might be able to find out who created it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hold on. To attack London’s power grid, you didn’t even need Hayley or Bryce.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: No. But that’s the way Edgar told Marcus it had to be.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I was chosen specifically.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: Yeah. And your buddy Bryce was only leveraged to do this job to get to you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Our Karla’s telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Motel security cameras prove that she was there during Bryce’s murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Lanie says that both Bryce and Marcus were stabbed by the same killer, so it looks like this Edgar guy is our new number-one suspect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any leads on our cigar smoker?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not yet. We’re gonna canvass smoking clubs throughout the city.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. If we’re lucky, somebody saw Marcus and Edgar meeting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about that laptop? Was Hayley able to identify who created that worm program?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Damn it.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You’ve been working that thing for hours. You need to take a break.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Uh, this Edgar fellow has a serious hurt-on for me, and he killed Bryce because of it. I’ll take a break when that bastard is dead. I’m in. I have unlocked the security for the worm.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I recognize this code.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You do? How?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Because I helped design it a long, long time ago.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: W- What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Damn it. His laptop is rubbish. I’m going to need something with more horsepower in order to get to the bottom of this.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’ll get your laptop from the back.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You’re a dear. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Now, if it’s partially your code, then that should help narrow down who the killer is, right? Hayley? Hayley...

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hayley.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, guys, we got something.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, one of those cigar clubs paid off. Manager recognized Marcus’ photo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he see who Marcus was with?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He said Marcus came in alone, and then he met with a guy in a brown leather jacket for about 15 minutes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he get a good look at him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. But the club security cam did. Look – brown leather jacket. Gotta be Edgar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This guy looks familiar. Hold on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Alexis.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, Hayley’s gone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gone where?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I don’t know, but she ditched her cell phone. I can’t track her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hang on. I’m putting you on speaker. What was the last thing Hayley did before she disappeared?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: She discovered the computer worm was one she helped design years ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Edgar used Hayley’s own code to help frame her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why did she take off right when she was closing in?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because she knows who the killer is, and his name isn’t Edgar. I did some research on her dead MI6 partner, Wesley Connors, and I found this article from six years ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Wesley Connors is the man in the brown leather jacket.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I knew he looked familiar.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This article says he’s been executed.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Guys, when Hayley recognized the code, she looked like she’d just seen a ghost.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s because she did. Wesley Connors is still alive.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hello? Wes. Come on out. It’s me.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: It worked, Hails. Our plan worked.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: This is impossible. Wesley Connors was caught and tried for espionage by the Iranians. Our intelligence sources confirmed he was executed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, obviously, they were duped.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Agent Mallory, this man perpetrated an attack on the London power grid and murdered two people, so it’s time to play ball and tell us what you know.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: What I am about to tell you is highly classified and mustn’t be repeated. Are we clear?

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: The worm that crashed the London power grid was one Hayley and Wesley designed six years ago. It was used to knock out uranium-enriching centrifuges at the Natanz reactor in Iran.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you talking about Stuxnet? That computer virus set the Iranian nuclear program back by decades.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stuxnet was supposedly created by the U.S. and Israel.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: Disinformation, Captain. Leaked by Her Majesty’s government. We wanted to hit the Iranians as much as everyone else, so we put our two best agents on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hayley and Wesley.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: Led by the recently deceased Bryce Roberts. The op was a success. However, their extraction point was compromised.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You said Hayley left Wesley to die.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: Yes, well, I might have exaggerated a bit to make a point. Truth is, Wesley was late to the rendezvous, and MI6 command made the call.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s why Hayley left MI6. She felt that they betrayed Wesley and condemned him to die.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: Which brings us to our current dilemma. Hayley and Wesley were thick as thieves, more loyal to each other than the service.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you saying?

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: That it would appear they have teamed up once again to have their retribution.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re wrong.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: Am I, Mr. Castle? Then tell me, why has Hayley suddenly disappeared?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I don’t understand. They showed me proof you were dead.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: No. I just wished I was.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: What did they do to you?

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: You know me. I hate taking orders, so sometimes I refused. But they never liked that. Sometimes I wished they’d just finish me off. There was times I tried to myself.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Wes, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: Don’t be. See, you’re the person that got me through it all. You know how? Our plan. It kept me going for six years, gave me the will to escape.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You keep saying “our plan”. I –

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: Our bloody retirement plan. Come on, Hails. We used to talk all the time about how if we survived the Queen’s service, we’d spend the rest of our days traveling the world in style. You remember.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: $10 million each.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: Yeah. Have you checked your bank account lately?

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: You passed the test.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: This was all a loyalty test?

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: It was the only way to know. I had to put a target on your back and make sure you wouldn’t capitulate to the authorities, but you didn’t.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Wesley, you murdered people. You killed Bryce.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: You’re damn right I did! He and Her Majesty’s kingdom abandoned me, so they had to be punished.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Which is why you sent our worm to plunge London into darkness. Oh, Wes, your captors drove you mad.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: How can you of all people say that to me? They had it coming. They all did. Don’t you see that?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Wesley, I’m sorry. I’m so, so sorry. I have to take you in.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: The rendezvous was predetermined. Predetermined because Hayley and Wesley are in league with one another.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They are not working together. But they were at one time. They were partners for years, working various black ops, maybe even one here in New York.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where they had an old safehouse or a staging area, someplace that they both knew about and could trust.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: Okay, look, I can neither confirm nor deny MI6 has ever carried out any operations on U.S. soil.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah. Just tell us where it is.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: I am shocked, Hayley. You always used to kick my ass whenever we sparred back in the day.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: So, what’s the plan, Wesley? You gonna torture me like they did you?

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: I would never do that to a friend. I’ll make it quick. It was fun for a moment, though, wasn’t it? The thought of us together, again?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Do you know why we were such effective spies? Because we lived for the rush of the mission.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: We were willing to die for that high.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: And we were wrong. After a lifetime of not letting anyone in, not even each other, I found people who tore down my walls. I found a family, and they’re wonderful.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: So that’s why I gave you such a kicking. You’ve went and got soft on me, Hayley.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Wesley, don’t do this. Let me help you.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: Help me? Love, you’re not in a position to help yourself.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Listen, I was your friend once, arguably the only one you’ve ever had in your entire life. Please let me be your friend once again.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: The only friend I need is my $10 million and perhaps yours.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Wesley, Wesley...

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Wesley. No. No!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Easy, easy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yeah. There are secret exits only Wesley and I know about. He’s gonna double back and disappear.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They went that way. We... Damn it.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Wesley. Let me see your hands.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Drop the knife.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: There’s only one way this is going to end.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Stop.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: Either you die or I die.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Wesley, don’t make me do this.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: Come on, Hails. You killed me once already.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Don’t. I hated myself for leaving you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN

utterance.content: Speaking of endings, I can’t think of a better way to end this day than by downing a few ice-cold ones with my lead detectives.

utterance.content: I heard you were single malt fans. From Her Majesty’s special reserve. She truly appreciates everyone’s discretion in this matter.

utterance.speaker: MALLORY
utterance.content: I come bearing another gift – an offer to return to service. MI6’s door is wide open to you, Agent Shipton. What do you say?

utterance.speaker: MALLORY

utterance.content: Hey. You all right?

utterance.content: You don’t have to mourn your friends alone, you know.

utterance.content: You know, the French would say, “Je suis désolé.” In Spanish, “Lo siento.” In Latin, “Mea culpa.”

utterance.content: Okay, you’re apologizing. I get it.

utterance.content: Yes. Because I have been keeping something from you that your subconscious mind picked up on and caused you to have a dream that I betrayed you in some way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does this mean that you won’t be having any more bad dreams about me tonight?

utterance.content: No. ‘Cause we’re not sleeping tonight.
